snippet: Leaders of a conference in Herndon, Va., say that one registry should oversee the complex matching process needed to expand the use of kidney transplant chains and other forms of paired donation.
abstract: Leaders of a conference in Herndon, Va, say that one nationwide registry should oversee the complex matching process needed to expand the use of kidney transplant chains and other forms of paired donation; nephrologists and transplant experts are hopeful that paired donation might chip away at the growing waiting list for kidneys from deceased donors.
lead_paragraph: Leaders of a conference in Herndon, Va., say that one registry should oversee the complex matching process needed to expand the use of kidney transplant chains and other forms of paired donation.

headline.seo: Kidney Experts Urge a Single Registry to Oversee Transplants
headline.main: Experts Recommend Single Registry to Oversee Kidney Transplant Donations
headline.print_headline: Experts Recommend Single Registry to Oversee Kidney Transplant Donations
